Types/AmmoType.description: Definition of actual parameters used in attack.

properties.name: category
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/AmmoCategory. Defines whether the attack will be affected by upgrades.

properties.name: action
properties.description: Describes actions taken upon attack happening.

properties.name: clamp_position
properties.description: When true, the gun will be able to shoot even when the target is out of range. Only applies when target_type is position. The gun will fire at the maximum range in the direction of the target position. Defaults to false.

properties.name: energy_consumption
properties.description: Energy consumption of a single shot, if applicable.

properties.name: target_type
properties.description: If this is "entity", clamp_position is forced to be false. "entity" fires at an entity, "position" fires directly at a position, "direction" fires in a direction.

properties.name: render_layer
properties.description: Default render layer for the rotations.

Types/Animation.description:
Specifies animation that can be used in the game.

Note that if any frame of the animation is specified from the same source as any other Types/Sprite or frame of other animation, it will be shared.

properties.name: layers
properties.description:
If this property is present, all Animation definitions have to be placed as entries in the array, and they will all be loaded from there. Each item (Animation definition) in the array may also have the layers property.

If this property is present, all other properties are ignored and the mandatory properties do not have to be defined.

Layers may not be an empty table.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description: If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, its contents are used to load the Animation.

properties.name: filename
properties.description: Mandatory if "stripes" is not specified.

properties.name: size
properties.description:
The width and height of the one frame. If this is an array, the first member of the array is the width and the second is the height. Otherwise the size is both width and height.

Width and height may only be in the range of 0-8192.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Mandatory if size is not given. Width of one frame in pixels, from 0-8192.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Mandatory if size is not given. Height of one frame in pixels, from 0-8192.

properties.name: x
properties.description: Horizontal position of the animation in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: y
properties.description: Vertical position of the animation in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: position
properties.description: Loaded only when x and y are both 0. The first member of the array is x and the second is y.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: Values different than 1 specify the scale of the animation on default zoom. Scale 2 means that the picture will be 2 times bigger on screen (and more pixelated).

properties.name: mipmap_count
properties.description: Only loaded if this is an icon (has flag "group=icon" or "group=gui").

properties.name: load_in_minimal_mode
properties.description: Minimal mode is entered when mod loading fails. You are in it when you see the gray box after (part of) the loading screen that tells you a mod error (Example). If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property.

properties.name: premul_alpha
properties.description: Whether alpha should be premultiplied.

properties.name: frame_count
properties.description: Can't be 0.

properties.name: animation_speed
properties.description: Once the specified number of pictures is loaded, other pictures are loaded on other line. This is to allow having longer animations in matrix, to avoid pictures with too big width. The game engine limits the width of any input picture to 2048px, so it is compatible with most graphics cards.

properties.name: repeat_count
properties.description: Can't be 0.

Types/Animation4Way.description: A map of animations for all 4 directions of the entity, or one Types/Animation that is used for all directions.

properties.name: north
properties.description: Optional. If omitted, the game will not look for any other directions and instead try to load the whole definition as one Types/Animation and apply it to all directions.

properties.name: sheets
properties.description: Optional. If given, this is used instead of any other properties that may be present.

properties.name: sheet
properties.description: Optional. If given, and #sheets isnt present, this is used instead of any other properties that may be present.

Types/AnimationFrameSequence.description:
This is a list of 1-based frame indices into the spritesheet. The actual length of the animation will then be the length of the frame_sequence (times repeat_count, times two if run_mode is "forward-then-backward"). There is a limit for (actual) animation length of 255 frames.

Indices can be used in any order, repeated or not used at all. Unused frames are not loaded into VRAM at all, frames referenced multiple times are loaded just once.[1]

properties.name: sheet
properties.description:
An animation. Does not use the layers property. The filename is mandatory.

The variations are arranged vertically in the file, one row for each variation.

properties.name: sheets
properties.description: Array of Types/Animation. The contained animations do not use the layers property. The filename is mandatory.

properties.name: line_length
properties.description: Default is the value of variation_count.

Types/AttackParameters.description: A types/table. The table is loaded as one of the extensions of Types/BaseAttackParameters, depending on the value of the type key.

Types/AutoplaceSpecification.description:
Autoplace specification is used to determine which entities are placed when generating map. Currently it is used for enemy bases, resources and other entities (trees, fishes, ...).

Autoplace specification describe conditions for placing tiles, entities, and decoratives during surface generation. Probability (of placement on any given tile) and richness (which has different meaning depending on the thing being placed) can be defined either in terms of a set of peaks, or using explicit expressions.

properties.name: control
properties.description: ID of autoplace control that applies to this entity.

properties.name: default_enabled
properties.description:
Indicates whether the thing should be placed even if MapGenSettings do not provide frequency/size/richness for it (either for the specific prototype of for the control named by AutoplaceSpecification.control).

If true, normal frequency/size/richness (value=1) are used in that case. Otherwise it is treated as if 'none' were selected.

properties.name: force
properties.description: Force of the placed entity. One of "enemy", "player", "neutral", or a custom force name. Only matters for EntityWithForce or EntityWithOwner.

properties.name: order
properties.description: Order for placing the entity (has no effect when placing tiles). Entities whose order compares less are placed earlier (this influences placing multiple entities which collide with itself), from entities with equal order string only one with the highest probability is placed.

properties.name: placement_density
properties.description: For entities and decoratives, how many times to attempt to place on each tile (probability and collisions are taken into account each attempt).

properties.name: tile_restriction
properties.description: For entities and decoratives, how many times to attempt to place on each tile (probability and collisions are taken into account each attempt).

properties.name: apply_module_tint
properties.description: Which tint set in Prototype/Module#beacon_tint should be applied to this, if any.

properties.name: apply_module_tint_to_light
properties.description: Which tint set in Prototype/Module#beacon_tint should be applied to the light, if any.

properties.name: module_visualisations
properties.description: The visualisations available for displaying the modules in the beacon. The visualisation is chosen based on art style, see Types/BeaconModuleVisualizations#art_style and Prototype/Module#art_style.

properties.name: module_tint_mode
properties.description: One of "single-module" or "mix".

value.normal: The result color is determined with the following formula: Result = Active_RGB * Active_Alpha + Background_RGB * ( 1 - Active_Alpha )
value.additive: The result color is determined with the following formula: Result = Active_RGB + Background_RGB
value.additive-soft: The result color is determined with the following formula: Result = Active_RGB * ( 1 - Background_RGB ) + Background_RGB
value.multiplicative: The result color is determined with the following formula: Result = Active_RGB * Background_RGB
value.overwrite: The result color is determined with the following formula: Result = Active_RGBA or Background_RGBA

Types/BoundingBox.description:
BoundingBox is set of two Types/Position. BoundingBoxes are typically centered around the position of an entity.

The first position is assumed to be leftTop, the second position is assumed to be rightBottom. A third member may be added, a Types/float that represents the orientation, however it does not seem to be used.

Types/CapsuleAction.description: The table is loaded as a specific capsule action, depending on the value of the type key.

properties.name: running_with_gun
properties.description: Must contain exactly 18 directions, so all of the combination of gun direction and moving direction can be covered. Some of these variations are used in reverse to save space. You can use the character animation in the base game for reference.

properties.name: flipped_shadow_running_with_gun
properties.description: flipped_shadow_running_with_gun must be nil or contain exactly 18 directions, so all of the combination of gun direction and moving direction can be covered. Some of these variations are used in reverse to save space. You can use the character animation in the base game for reference. flipped_shadow_running_with_gun has to have same frame count as running_with_gun.

properties.name: armors
properties.description: The names of the armors this animation data is used for. Don't define this if you want the animations to be used for the player without armor.

value.not-colliding-with-itself: Any 2 entities that both have this option enabled on their prototype and have an identical collision mask layers list will not collide. Other collision mask options are not included in the identical layer list check. This does mean that 2 different prototypes with the same collision mask layers and this option enabled will not collide.
value.consider-tile-transitions: Uses the prototypes position rather than its collision box when doing collision checks with tile prototypes. Allows the prototype to overlap colliding tiles up until its center point. This is only respected for character movement and cars driven by players.
value.colliding-with-tiles-only: Any prototype with this collision option will only be checked for collision with other prototype's collision masks if they are a tile.

Types/Color.description:
Table of red, green, blue, and alpha float values between 0 and 1. All values are optional, default optional value for colors is 0, for alpha 1. Alternatively, values can be from 0-255, they are interpreted as such if at least one value is > 1.

Color allows the short-hand notation of passing an array of exactly 3 or 4 numbers.

The game usually expects colors to be in pre-multiplied form (color channels are pre-multiplied by alpha).

properties.name: r
properties.description: red value

properties.name: g
properties.description: green value

properties.name: b
properties.description: blue value

properties.name: a
properties.description: alpha value - transparency

Types/ConsumingType.description: A Types/string that defines which other inputs a Prototype/CustomInput consumes.

value.none: The associated script event will fire when satisfied and pass through to normal game events (default).
value.game-only: The associated script event will fire when satisfied and block game events that conflict with the key sequence. Actions that are processed regardless of game paused state cannot be blocked.

properties.name: smoke_name
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/TrivialSmoke.

Types/DamagePrototype.description: A property type, NOT a prototype. Used to specify what type of damage and how much damage something deals.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of damage. See Data.raw#damage-type for a list of built-in types, and Prototype/DamageType for creating custom types.

Types/DaytimeColorLookupTable.description:
An array of arrays.

The first member of the inner array must be a double, second member of the inner array must be a FileName or "identity". The file pointed to by the filename must be a sprite of size 16x16.

zoom_to_world_daytime_color_lookup = { {0.25, "identity"}, {0.45, "__core__/graphics/color_luts/night.png"}, {0.55, "__core__/graphics/color_luts/night.png"}, {0.75, "identity"}, }

Types/EffectTypeLimitation.description: A list of module effects or just one module effect as a string. Modules with other effects cannot be used on the machine. This means that both effects from modules and from surrounding beacons are restricted to the listed effects. If allowed_effects is set to nil, the machine cannot be affected by modules or beacons.

value.speed: Modules that increase or decrease the machine's speed.
value.productivity: Modules that make the machine produce bonus items.
value.consumption: Modules that increase or decrease the machine's energy consumption.
value.pollution: Modules that make the machine produce more or less pollution.

Types/Energy.description:
Uses Types/string to specify the amount of electric energy in joules or electric energy per time in watts.

Internally, the input in Watt or Joule/second is always converted into Joule/tick or Joule/(1/60)second, using the following formula: Power in Joule/tick = Power in Watt / 60 (Units#Power).

properties.name: emissions_per_minute
properties.description: The pollution an entity emits per minute at full energy consumption. emissions_per_minute is exactly the value that is shown in the entity tooltip.

properties.name: render_no_power_icon
properties.description: Optional. Whether to render the Electricity-icon-red.png icon on the entity if it is low on power. Also applies to Fuel-icon-red.png when using a burner energy source.

properties.name: render_no_network_icon
properties.description: Optional. Whether to render the Electricity-icon-unplugged.png icon on the entity if it is not connected to a electric network.

properties.name: buffer_capacity
properties.description: Optional. How much power the entity holds.

properties.name: input_flow_limit
properties.description: How fast the energy can flow into the entity. 0 means 0.

properties.name: output_flow_limit
properties.description: How fast the energy can flow out of the entity. 0 means 0.

properties.name: drain
properties.description: How much energy the entity will always "drain" from the network, even when not in use.

properties.name: smoke
properties.description: Array of 1 or more smoke sources.

properties.name: effectivity
properties.description: 1 means 100% effectivity. Must be greater than 0. Multiplier of the energy output.

properties.name: fuel_category
properties.description: The energy source can be used with fuel from this fuel category. For a list on built-in categories, see Data.raw#fuel-category.

properties.name: fuel_categories
properties.description: Same as above, only one of them can exist. For a list on built-in categories, see Data.raw#fuel-category.

properties.name: max_temperature
properties.description: max_temperature must be >= default_temperature.

properties.name: min_working_temperature
properties.description: min_working_temperature must be >= default_temperature. min_working_temperature must be <= max_temperature.

properties.name: connections
properties.description: The table may only contain up to 32 connections.

properties.name: fluid_box
properties.description: All standard fluid box configurations are acceptable, but the type must be "input" or "input-output" to function correctly. Scale_fluid_usage, fluid_usage_per_tick or a filter on the fluidbox must be set to be able to calculate the fluid usage of the energy source.

properties.name: smoke
properties.description: Array of 1 or more smoke sources.

properties.name: effectivity
properties.description: 1 means 100% effectivity. Must be greater than 0. Multiplier of the energy output.

properties.name: burns_fluid
properties.description: Optional. If set to true, the energy source will calculate power based on the fluid's fuel_value entry, else it will calculate based on fluid temperature, like Prototype/Generator.

properties.name: scale_fluid_usage
properties.description: If set to true, the energy source will consume as much fluid as required to produce the desired power, if set to false it will consume as much as it is allowed to, wasting any excess.

properties.name: fluid_usage_per_tick
properties.description: The number of fluid units the energy source uses per tick. If used with scale_fluid_usage, this specifies the maximum. If this value is not set, scale_energy_usage = false and a fluid box filter is set, the game will attempt to calculate this value from the fluid box filter's fluid's fuel_value or heat_capacity and the entity's energy_usage. If burns_fluid is false, maximum_temperature will also be used.

properties.name: maximum_temperature
properties.description: If it is specified while scale_fluid_usage = false and fluid_usage_per_tick is not specified, the game will use this value to calculate fluid_usage_per_tick.

value.not-rotatable: Can't be rotated before or after placing.
value.placeable-player: placeable neutral/player/enemy determine the default force when placing entities in the map editor and using the *AUTO* option for the force.
value.placeable-neutral: placeable neutral/player/enemy determine the default force when placing entities in the map editor and using the *AUTO* option for the force.
value.placeable-enemy: placeable neutral/player/enemy determine the default force when placing entities in the map editor and using the *AUTO* option for the force.
value.placeable-off-grid: placeable-off-grid refers to the fact that most entities are placed on an invisible 'grid' within the world, entities with the placeable-off-grid flag do not have to line up with this grid (like trees and land-mines)
value.player-creation: Makes it possible for the biter AI to target the entity as a distraction. Makes it possible to blueprint, deconstruct, and repair the entity (can be turned off again using the specific flags). Enables smoke to be created automatically when building the entity.
value.building-direction-8-way: Uses 45 degree angle increments when selecting direction.
value.filter-directions: Used to automatically detect the proper direction, if possible. Used by base with the pump, train stop, and train signal.
value.fast-replaceable-no-build-while-moving: Fast replace will not apply when building while moving.
value.breaths-air: This is used to specify that the entity breathes air, and so is affected by poison (currently poison capsules are the only source).
value.not-repairable: Used to specify that the entity can not be 'healed' by repair-packs (or construction robots with repair packs)
value.not-on-map: The entity does not get drawn on the map.
value.not-blueprintable: The entity can't be used in blueprints.
value.hidden: Hides the entity from the bonus GUI (button above the map) and from the made in property of recipe tooltips.
value.hide-alt-info: Hides the alt-info of an entity in alt-mode, for example the recipe icon.
value.fast-replaceable-no-cross-type-while-mov: Do not fast replace over other entity types when building while moving.
value.not-flammable: Do not apply fire stickers to the entity.
value.no-automated-item-removal: Prevents inserters and loaders from taking items from this entity.
value.no-automated-item-insertion: Prevents inserters and loaders from inserting items into this entity.
value.not-upgradable: The entity can't be selected by the upgrade planner.
value.not-in-kill-statistics: The entity is not shown in the kill statistics.

Types/EquipmentShape.description: The shape and dimensions of an equipment module.

properties.name: points
properties.description: Only used when when using type "manual". Each inner array is a "position" inside widthheight of the equipment. Each positions that is defined is a filled squares of the equipment shape. {0, 0} is the upper left corner of the equipment.

Types/ExplosionDefinition.description: Used by Prototype/EntityWithHealth#dying_explosion. This is either a Types/string that is the name of a Prototype/Entity, or a table with the below properties.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Entity.

Types/FileName.description: Slash (/) is always used as directory delimiter.

Types/FluidBox.description: Used to set the fluid amount an entity can hold, as well as the connection points for pipes leading into and out of the entity.

properties.name: pipe_connections
properties.description: Max number of members is 255.

properties.name: base_area
properties.description: Must be greater than 0.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Must be greater than 0.

properties.name: filter
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Fluid. Can be used to specify which fluid is allowed to enter this fluid box. [1]

properties.name: pipe_covers
properties.description: The pictures to show when another fluid box connects to this one.

properties.name: minimum_temperature
properties.description: The minimum temperature allowed into the fluidbox. Only applied if a filter is specified [2].

properties.name: maximum_temperature
properties.description: The maximum temperature allowed into the fluidbox. Only applied if a filter is specified [3].

properties.name: secondary_draw_order
properties.description: Set the secondary draw order for all orientations.

properties.name: secondary_draw_orders
properties.description: Set the secondary draw order for each orientation.

properties.name: tiles
properties.description: Array of names of Prototype/Tiles. The tiles this footprint particle is shown on when the player walks over them.

properties.name: particle_name
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Particle. The name of the particle that should be created when the character walks on the defined tiles.

properties.name: use_as_default
properties.description: Whether this footprint particle should be the default particle that is used for #tiles that don't have an associated footprint particle.

properties.name: tiles
properties.description: Each CreateParticleTriggerEffectItem needs the extra mandatory property tiles, which is a table (array) of string which is the name of a tile.

properties.name: actions
properties.description: Alternatively, instead of specifying the CreateParticleTriggerEffectItem directly in the table with the tiles property, a actions property that is an array of CreateParticleTriggerEffectItem can be specified in the table with the tiles property.

properties.name: use_as_default
properties.description: Furthermore, the table with the tiles property can contain a use_as_default property which is a boolean value. use_as_default defaults to false. When it is set to true, the trigger(s) defined in that table are the default triggers for tiles that don't have an associated footstep particle trigger (don't show up in one of the "tiles" lists).

Types/HeatBuffer.description: Used to specify heat capacity properties without a heat energy source.

properties.name: max_temperature
properties.description: Must be >= default_temperature.

properties.name: min_working_temperature
properties.description: Must be >= default_temperature and <= max_temperature.

properties.name: connections
properties.description: The table may only contain up to 32 connections.

Types/IngredientPrototype.description: Class used for Prototype/Recipe ingredients, it loads as Types/ItemIngredientPrototype or Types/FluidIngredientPrototype, depending on the #type.

Types/int8.description: 8-bit signed integer. Possible values are 128 to 127.

Types/int16.description: 16 bit signed number. The range is -32,768 to 32,767 or [-2^15, 2^15 - 1].

Types/int32.description: 32 bit signed number. The range is [-2^31, 2^31 - 1] or [-2147483648, 2147483647] or approximately 2 billion 147 million.

Types/ItemProductPrototype.description: An item product definition for a Prototype/Recipe. Its loading is triggered by the type of a Types/ProductPrototype being "item". It can be specified as a table with named or numbered keys, but not a mix of both.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of a Prototype/Item.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: Mandatory when using numbered keys (an array).

properties.name: probability
properties.description: Value between 0 and 1, 0 for 0% chance and 1 for 100% chance.

properties.name: amount_min
properties.description: Mandatory if amount is not specified and named keys are being used.

properties.name: amount_max
properties.description:
Mandatory if amount is not specified and named keys are being used.

If set to a number that is less than amount_min, the game will use amount_min internally.

properties.name: catalyst_amount
properties.description: Amount that should not be affected by productivity modules (not yielded from bonus production) and should not be included in the item production statistics.

value.draw-logistic-overlay: Whether the logistics areas of roboports should be drawn when holding this item. Used for example by the deconstruction planner.
value.hidden: Item will not appear in lists of all items such as those for logistics requests, filters, etc.
value.always-show: Always show the item in selection lists (item filter, logistic request etc.) even when locked recipe for that item is present.
value.hide-from-bonus-gui: Item will not appear in the bonus gui.
value.hide-from-fuel-tooltip: Item will not appear in the tooltips shown when hovering over a burner inventory with the fuel category the item is in.
value.not-stackable: The item can never be stacked.
value.mod-openable:
Only works for Prototype/SelectionTool and derived classes.
This property corresponds to the following event in the lua api: defines.events.on_mod_item_opened
value.only-in-cursor: Item is deleted when removed from the cursor by pressing Q (clear cursor). Used for example by the copy paste tools.

Types/ItemToPlace.description: Type for placeable_by for entities: Item that when placed creates this entity.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The item used to place this entity.

properties.name: count
properties.description: How many items are used to place one of this entity. Can't be larger than the stack size of the item.

Types/LightDefinitionBasic.description: Type for placeable_by for entities: Item that when placed creates this entity.

properties.name: intensity
properties.description: Brightness of the light in the range [0, 1] where 0 is no light and 1 is the maximum light.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The radius of the light in tiles. Note, that the light gets darker near the edges, so the effective size of the light seems to be smaller.

properties.name: color
properties.description: Color of the light.

Types/LightDefinitionOriented.description: Type for placeable_by for entities: Item that when placed creates this entity.

Types/LootValue.description: Type for loot for Prototype/EntityWithHealth: The loot is generated when the entity is killed.

properties.name: item
properties.description: The item to spawn.

properties.name: probability
properties.description: 0 is 0% and 1 is 100%. Must be > 0.

properties.name: count_max
properties.description: Must be > 0.

Types/MinableProperties.description: The mining properties of objects. For formulas for the mining time, see mining.

properties.name: mining_time
properties.description: How long it takes to mine this object.

properties.name: results
properties.description: The items that are returned when this object is mined.

properties.name: result
properties.description:
Only loaded if results was not found. Which item is dropped when this is mined.

Cannot be empty. If you want the entity to not be minable, don't specify the minable properties, if you want it to be minable with no result item, don't specify the result at all.

properties.name: fluid_amount
properties.description: The amount of fluid that is used up when this object is mined. If this is > 0, this object cannot be mined by hand.

properties.name: mining_particle
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Particle. Which set of particles to use.

properties.name: required_fluid
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Fluid. The fluid that is used up when this object is mined.

properties.name: count
properties.description: Only loaded if results was not found. How many of result are dropped.

properties.name: idle_animation
properties.description: Idle animation must have the same frame count as animation.

properties.name: always_draw_idle_animation
properties.description: Only loaded if idle_animation is present.

properties.name: shift_animation_waypoints
properties.description: Only loaded if one of shift_animation_waypoint_stop_duration or shift_animation_transition_duration is not 0.

properties.name: shift_animation_waypoint_stop_duration
properties.description: Only loaded if shift_animation_waypoints is present.

properties.name: shift_animation_transition_duration
properties.description: Only loaded if shift_animation_waypoints is present.

properties.name: circuit_connector_layer
properties.description: Renderlayer(s) for all directions of the circuit connectors.

properties.name: circuit_connector_secondary_draw_order
properties.description: Secondary draw order(s) for all directions of the circuit connectors.

Types/ModuleSpecification.description: The number of module slots in this entity, and their icon positions.

properties.name: module_slots
properties.description: The number of module slots in this entity.

properties.name: module_info_max_icons_per_row
properties.description: Default: width of entity selection box / 0.75

properties.name: module_info_max_icon_rows
properties.description: Default: width of entity selection box / 1.5

properties.name: module_info_icon_shift
properties.description: Default: {0, 0.7}

Types/NoiseExpression.description:
A fragment of a functional program used to generate coherent noise, probably for purposes related to terrain generation.

Noise expressions can be provided as table literals or built using functions in the built-in noise library. The built-in noise library allows writing much more concise code, so its usage will be shown in most examples on this page.
noise.define_noise_function allows noise expressions to be defined using a shorthand that's a subset of Lua (see example definition for an example and its literal equivalent).

Types/NoiseExpression is used by NamedNoiseExpressionPrototype::expression, AutoplaceSpecification::probability_expression and AutoplaceSpecification::richness_expression.

Types/Order.description:
The order property is a simple string. When the game needs to sort prototypes, it looks at their order properties and sorts those alphabetically. A prototype with an order string of "a" will be listed before other prototypes with order string "b" or "c". The "-" or "[]" structures that can be found in vanilla order strings do not have any special meaning.

When the game compares two prototypes (of the same type) if the order strings aren't equal they're lexicographically compared to determine if a given prototype is shown before or after another. If the order strings are equal then the game falls back to comparing the prototype names to determine order.

properties.name: result
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Tile.

properties.name: condition
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Tile.

Types/ProductPrototype.description: Class used for Prototype/Recipe prodcuts, it loads as Types/ItemProductPrototype or Types/FluidProductPrototype, depending on the #type.

properties.name: show_details_in_recipe_tooltip
properties.description: When hovering over a recipe in the crafting menu the recipe tooltip will be shown. An additional item tooltip will be shown for every product, as a separate tooltip, if the item tooltip has a description and/or properties to show and if show_details_in_recipe_tooltip is true.

properties.name: show_details_in_recipe_tooltip
properties.description: When hovering over a recipe in the crafting menu the recipe tooltip will be shown. An additional item tooltip will be shown for every product, as a separate tooltip, if the item tooltip has a description and/or properties to show and if show_details_in_recipe_tooltip is true.

Types/PumpConnectorGraphics.description: A mapping of arrays of mappings of Types/string to Types/Animations to all 4 directions of the pump connection (to a fluid wagon).

properties.name: north
properties.description: Size of the table must be 6 or more. Each value of the table is a mapping of Types/string to Types/Animation. The following strings are recognized: standup_base, standup_top, standup_shadow, connector, connector_shadow.

properties.name: west
properties.description: Size of the table must be 6 or more. Each value of the table is a mapping of Types/string to Types/Animation. The following strings are recognized: standup_base, standup_top, standup_shadow, connector, connector_shadow.

properties.name: south
properties.description: Size of the table must be 6 or more. Each value of the table is a mapping of Types/string to Types/Animation. The following strings are recognized: standup_base, standup_top, standup_shadow, connector, connector_shadow.

properties.name: east
properties.description: Size of the table must be 6 or more. Each value of the table is a mapping of Types/string to Types/Animation. The following strings are recognized: standup_base, standup_top, standup_shadow, connector, connector_shadow.

Types/RadiusVisualisationSpecification.description: Sprite to be shown around the entity when it is selected/held in the cursor.

properties.name: distance
properties.description: Must be > 0.

Types/Resistances.description: Resistances to certain types of attacks from enemy, and physical damage. See Damage.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Specification of the type. Name of a Prototype/DamageType.

properties.name: decrease
properties.description: The flat resistance to the given damage type. (Higher is better)

properties.name: percent
properties.description: The percentage resistance to the given damage type. (Higher is better)

properties.name: layers
properties.description:
If this property is present, all RotatedAnimation definitions have to be placed as entries in the array, and they will all be loaded from there. Each item (RotatedAnimation definition) in the array may also have the layers property.

If this property is present, all other properties are ignored and the mandatory properties do not have to be defined.

Layers may not be an empty table.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description: If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, its contents are used to load the RotatedAnimation.

properties.name: filename
properties.description: Mandatory if stripes and filenames is not specified.

properties.name: filenames
properties.description: Only loaded if stripes is not present.

properties.name: slice
properties.description: Mandatory if filenames is present.

properties.name: lines_per_file
properties.description: Mandatory if filenames is present.

properties.name: size
properties.description:
The width and height of the one frame. If this is an array, the first member of the array is the width and the second is the height. Otherwise the size is both width and height.

Width and height may only be in the range of 0-8192.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Mandatory if size is not given. Width of one frame in pixels, from 0-8192.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Mandatory if size is not given. Height of one frame in pixels, from 0-8192.

properties.name: x
properties.description: Horizontal position of the animation in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: y
properties.description: Vertical position of the animation in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: position
properties.description: Loaded only when x and y are both 0. The first member of the array is x and the second is y.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: Values different than 1 specify the scale of the animation on default zoom. Scale 2 means that the picture will be 2 times bigger on screen (and more pixelated).

properties.name: mipmap_count
properties.description: Only loaded if this is an icon (has flag "group=icon" or "group=gui").

properties.name: load_in_minimal_mode
properties.description: Minimal mode is entered when mod loading fails. You are in it when you see the gray box after (part of) the loading screen that tells you a mod error (Example). If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property.

properties.name: premul_alpha
properties.description: Whether alpha should be premultiplied.

properties.name: frame_count
properties.description: Can't be 0.

properties.name: line_length
properties.description: Once the specified number of pictures is loaded, other pictures are loaded on other line. This is to allow having longer animations in matrix, to avoid pictures with too big width. The game engine limits the width of any input picture to 2048px, so it is compatible with most graphics cards.

properties.name: animation_speed
properties.description: Modifier of the animation playing speed, the default is 1, which means one animation frame per tick (60 fps). The speed of playing can often vary depending on the usage (output of steam engine for example). Has to be greater than 0.

properties.name: repeat_count
properties.description: Can't be 0.

properties.name: axially_symmetrical
properties.description: If true, direction_count must be greater than 1.

properties.name: orientation_range
properties.description: Automatically clamped to be between 0 and 1.

Types/RotatedAnimation4Way.description: A map of rotated animations for all 4 directions of the entity, or one Types/RotatedAnimation that is used for all directions.

properties.name: north
properties.description:
Optional. If omitted, the game will not look for any other directions and instead try to load the whole definition as one Types/RotatedAnimation and apply it to all directions.

If north is present, but no other directions are present, the north rotated animation is used for all directions.

properties.name: east
properties.description: If east is present, but west is not present, the east rotated animation is used for the west direction.

Types/RotatedSprite.description: Specifies series of sprites used to visualise different rotations of the object.

properties.name: direction_count
properties.description: Count of direction (frames) specified.

properties.name: filename
properties.description: Either this or "filenames" has to be non-empty.

properties.name: filenames
properties.description: Array of filenames. Either this or "filename" has to be non-empty.

properties.name: layers
properties.description:
If this property is present, all RotatedSprite definitions have to be placed as entries in the array, and they will all be loaded from there. Each item (RotatedSprite definition) in the array may also have the layers property.

If this property is present, all other properties are ignored and the mandatory properties do not have to be defined.

Layers may not be an empty table.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description: If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, its contents are used to load the RotatedSprite.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description: If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, its contents are used to load the RotatedSprite.

properties.name: slice
properties.description:
Number of slices this is sliced into when using the "optimized atlas packing" option. If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property.

Example: If this is 4, the sprite will be sliced into a 44 grid.

properties.name: dice
properties.description:
Number of slices this is sliced into when using the "optimized atlas packing" option. If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property.

Example: If this is 4, the sprite will be sliced into a 44 grid.

properties.name: slice_x
properties.description: Same as slice or dice above, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the x axis.

properties.name: dice_x
properties.description: Same as slice or dice above, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the x axis.

properties.name: slice_y
properties.description: Same as slice or dice above, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the y axis.

properties.name: dice_y
properties.description: Same as slice or dice above, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the y axis.

properties.name: size
properties.description:
The width and height of the sprite. If this is an array, the first member of the array is the width and the second is the height. Otherwise the size is both width and height.

Width and height may only be in the range of 0-8192.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Mandatory if size is not given. Width of the picture in pixels, from 0-8192.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Mandatory if size is not given. Height of the picture in pixels, from 0-8192.

properties.name: x
properties.description: Horizontal position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: y
properties.description: Vertical position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: position
properties.description: Loaded only when x and y are both 0. The first member of the array is x and the second is y.

properties.name: shift
properties.description: In tiles. util.by_pixel() can be used to divide the shift by 32 which is the usual pixel height/width of 1 tile in normal resolution. Note that 32 pixel tile height/width is not enforced anywhere - any other tile height or width is also possible.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: Values different than 1 specify the scale of the sprite on default zoom. Scale 2 means that the picture will be 2 times bigger on screen (and more pixelated).

properties.name: mipmap_count
properties.description: Only loaded if this is an icon (has flag "group=icon" or "group=gui").

properties.name: load_in_minimal_mode
properties.description: Minimal mode is entered when mod loading fails. You are in it when you see the gray box after (part of) the loading screen that tells you a mod error (Example). If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property.

properties.name: premul_alpha
properties.description: Whether alpha should be premultiplied.

properties.name: axially_symmetrical
properties.description: When set to true, left the same picture is used for left/right direction, just flipped, this can save half of the space required, but is not usable once the picture contains shadows etc.

properties.name: apply_projection
properties.description: Used to fix the inconsistency of direction of the entity in 3d when rendered and direction on the screen (where the 45 degree angle for projection is used).

properties.name: counterclockwise
properties.description: Set to true to indicate sprites in the spritesheet are in counterclockwise order.

properties.name: line_length
properties.description: Used to specify the individual images in grid. 0 means that all the picture are in one horizontal line.

properties.name: lines_per_file
properties.description: Mandatory if "filenames" exists.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the signal that shows this color.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the signal that shows this color.

properties.name: color
properties.description: The color this signal shows.

Types/SignalIDConnector.description: Refers to an existing circuit network signal.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of a circuit network signal, it has to have the type that is specified in this definition. For example name = "iron-plate" would only work with type = "item", and type = "fluid" would need a fluid signal as the name, for example "crude-oil" or "water".

Types/SmokeSource.description: Definition of the smoke of an entity.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/TrivialSmoke

properties.name: frequency
properties.description: Can't be negative, NaN or infinite.

properties.name: filename
properties.description: Mandatory if variations is not given.

properties.name: volume
properties.description: Only loaded if variations is not given.

properties.name: preload
properties.description: Only loaded if variations is not given.

properties.name: speed
properties.description: Only loaded if variations is not given. Speed must be >= 1 / 64. This sets both min and max speed.

properties.name: min_speed
properties.description: Only loaded if variations is not given. Not loaded if speed is present. Speed must be >= 1 / 64.

properties.name: max_speed
properties.description: Only loaded if variations is not given. Mandatory if min_speed is present, otherwise not loaded. Must be >= min_speed.

properties.name: speed
properties.description: Speed must be >= 1 / 64. This sets both min and max speed.

properties.name: min_speed
properties.description: Not loaded if speed is present. Speed must be >= 1 / 64.

properties.name: max_speed
properties.description: Mandatory if min_speed is present, otherwise not loaded. Must be >= min_speed.

Types/Sprite.description:
Specifies one picture that can be used in the game.

When there is more than one sprite or animation frame with the same source file and dimensions/position in the game, they all share the same memory.

properties.name: filename
properties.description: Technically optional, but path to sprite cannot be empty.

properties.name: layers
properties.description:
If this property is present, all Sprite definitions have to be placed as entries in the array, and they will all be loaded from there. Each item (Sprite definition) in the array may also have the layers property.

If this property is present, all other properties are ignored and the mandatory properties do not have to be defined.

Layers may not be an empty table.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description: If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, its contents are used to load the sprite.

properties.name: slice
properties.description:
Number of slices this is sliced into when using the "optimized atlas packing" option. If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property.

Example: If this is 4, the sprite will be sliced into a 44 grid.

properties.name: dice
properties.description:
Number of slices this is sliced into when using the "optimized atlas packing" option. If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property.

Example: If this is 4, the sprite will be sliced into a 44 grid.

properties.name: slice_x
properties.description: Same as slice or dice above, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the x axis.

properties.name: dice_x
properties.description: Same as slice or dice above, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the x axis.

properties.name: slice_y
properties.description: Same as slice or dice above, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the y axis.

properties.name: dice_y
properties.description: Same as slice or dice above, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the y axis.

properties.name: size
properties.description:
The width and height of the sprite. If this is an array, the first member of the array is the width and the second is the height. Otherwise the size is both width and height.

Width and height may only be in the range of 0-8192.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Mandatory if size is not given. Width of the picture in pixels, from 0-8192.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Mandatory if size is not given. Height of the picture in pixels, from 0-8192.

properties.name: x
properties.description: Horizontal position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: y
properties.description: Vertical position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: position
properties.description: Loaded only when x and y are both 0. The first member of the array is x and the second is y.

properties.name: shift
properties.description: In tiles. util.by_pixel() can be used to divide the shift by 32 which is the usual pixel height/width of 1 tile in normal resolution. Note that 32 pixel tile height/width is not enforced anywhere - any other tile height or width is also possible.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: Values different than 1 specify the scale of the sprite on default zoom. Scale 2 means that the picture will be 2 times bigger on screen (and more pixelated).

properties.name: mipmap_count
properties.description: Only loaded if this is an icon (has flag "group=icon" or "group=gui").

properties.name: load_in_minimal_mode
properties.description: Minimal mode is entered when mod loading fails. You are in it when you see the gray box after (part of) the loading screen that tells you a mod error (Example). If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property.

properties.name: premul_alpha
properties.description: Whether alpha should be premultiplied.

properties.name: north
properties.description: Optional. If omitted and neither #sheets or #sheet are present, the game will not look for any other directions and instead try to load the whole definition as one Types/Sprite and apply it to all directions.

properties.name: sheets
properties.description: Optional. If given, this is used instead of any other properties that may be present.

properties.name: sheet
properties.description: Optional. If given, and #sheets isnt present, this is used instead of any other properties that may be present.

value.no-crop: The sprite won't be automatically cropped.
value.mask:
When this flag is set, it will automatically set these flags:

  • "group=none"
value.icon:
When this flag is set, it will automatically set these flags:

  • "no-crop"
  • "no-scale"
  • "mipmap"
  • "linear-minification"
  • "linear-magnification"
  • "linear-mip-level"
  • "not-compressed"
  • "group=icon"
value.gui:
When this flag is set, it will automatically set these flags:

  • "no-crop"
  • "no-scale"
  • "mipmap"
  • "linear-minification"
  • "linear-magnification"
  • "linear-mip-level"
  • "not-compressed"
  • "group=gui"
value.gui-icon:
When this flag is set, it will automatically set these flags:

  • "no-crop"
  • "no-scale"
  • "mipmap"
  • "linear-minification"
  • "linear-magnification"
  • "not-compressed"
  • "group=icon"
value.light:
When this flag is set, it will automatically set these flags:

  • "no-crop"
  • "no-scale"
  • "mipmap"
  • "linear-minification"
  • "linear-magnification"
  • "linear-mip-level"
  • "group=none"
value.terrain:
When this flag is set, it will automatically set these flags:

  • "no-crop"
  • "mipmap"
  • "linear-minification"
  • "linear-mip-level"
  • "group=terrain"
value.smoke:
When this flag is set, it will automatically set these flags:

  • "mipmap"
  • "linear-minification"
  • "linear-magnification"
  • "group=smoke"
value.decal:
When this flag is set, it will automatically set these flags:

  • "group=decal"
value.compressed: Deprecated flag that does nothing but is kept to prevent "unknown sprite flag" errors.

Types/SpritePriority.description: This sets the "caching priority" of a sprite, so deciding priority of it being included in VRAM instead of streaming it and is therefore a purely technical value.[1][2] The possible values are listed below.

properties.name: line_length
properties.description: Default is the value of variation_count.

Types/Stripe.description: Used as an alternative way to specify animations.

properties.name: height_in_frames
properties.description: Mandatory when Types/Stripe is used in Types/Animation, optional when it is used in Types/RotatedAnimation and then it defaults to Types/RotatedAnimation#direction_count.

properties.name: side
properties.description: This or side_mask needs to be specified if empty_transitions is not true.

properties.name: side_mask
properties.description: This or side needs to be specified if empty_transitions is not true.

properties.name: inner_corner
properties.description: This or inner_corner_mask needs to be specified if empty_transitions is not true.

properties.name: inner_corner_mask
properties.description: This or inner_corner needs to be specified if empty_transitions is not true.

properties.name: outer_corner
properties.description: This or outer_corner_mask needs to be specified if empty_transitions is not true.

properties.name: outer_corner_mask
properties.description: This or outer_corner needs to be specified if empty_transitions is not true.

Types/TransportBeltConnectorFrame.description: Used to define the graphics for the (in vanilla) yellow frame that is used when a Prototype/TransportBelt is connected to the circuit network.

properties.name: trunk
properties.description: If shadow is not specified, this has to have one more frame than leaves.

properties.name: shadow
properties.description: Shadow must have 1 less frame_count than leaves (shadow.frame_count = leaves.frame_count + 1).

properties.name: disable_shadow_distortion_beginning_at_frame
properties.description: Only loaded if shadow is present. Defaults to shadow.frame_count - 1.

properties.name: normal
properties.description: Normal must have the same frame_count as leaves (normal.frame_count = leaves.frame_count).

Types/uint8.description: 8-bit unsigned integer. Possible values are 0 to 255.

Types/uint16.description: 16 bit unsigned number. The range is [0, 2^16-1] or [0, 65535]

Types/uint32.description: 32 bit unsigned number. The range is [0, 2^32-1] or [0, 4294967295] or approximately 4 billion 294 million.

properties.name: destroy_when_commands_fail
properties.description: If enabled, units that repeatedly fail to succeed at commands will be destroyed.

properties.name: allow_try_return_to_spawner
properties.description: If enabled, units that have nothing else to do will attempt to return to a spawner.

properties.name: do_separation
properties.description: If enabled, units will try to separate themselves from nearby friendly units.

properties.name: path_resolution_modifier
properties.description: Must be between -8 and 8.

Types/UnitSpawnDefinition.description: The definition of a spawnable unit for a Prototype/EnemySpawner. It can be specified as a table with named or numbered keys, but not a mix of both.

properties.name: unit
properties.description: The name of a Prototype/Entity.

properties.name: spawn_points
properties.description: Array of evolution and probability info. The evolution_factor must be ascending from entry to entry.

Types/vector.description: A vector is a two-element array containing the x and y components. Unlike Positions, vectors don't use the x, y keys. Positive x goes towards east, positive y goes towards south.

Types/Vector3D.description: table of three floats. Either specified as an array, or with the named keys "x", "y" and "z".

Types/WireConnectionPoint.description: Definition of a point where circuit network wires can be connected to an entity.

Types/WorkingSound.description: This type is used to produce sound from in-game entities when they are working/idle.

properties.name: sound
properties.description: The sound to be played when the entity is working. If sound is not present, the entire WorkingSound is loaded as a Types/Sound.

properties.name: audible_distance_modifier
properties.description: Modifies how far a sound can be heard. Can only be 1 or lower, has to be a positive number.

properties.name: probability
properties.description: Modifies how often the sound is played.

properties.name: fade_in_ticks
properties.description: Can't be used when match_progress_to_activity is true.

properties.name: fade_out_ticks
properties.description: Can't be used when match_progress_to_activity is true.

properties.name: idle_sound
properties.description: The sound to be played when the entity is idle. Might not work with all entities that use working_sound.

properties.name: activate_sound
properties.description: Might not work with all entities that use working_sound.

properties.name: deactivate_sound
properties.description: Might not work with all entities that use working_sound.

Types/WorkingVisualisation.description: Used by crafting machines to display different graphics when the machine is running.

properties.name: constant_speed
properties.description: Whether the animations are always played at the same speed, not adjusted to the machine speed.

properties.name: apply_tint
properties.description: Used by Prototype/CraftingMachine ("status" only) and Prototype/MiningDrill.

properties.name: north_animation
properties.description: Either these animations for the directions are loaded, or animation and the positions for the directions are loaded.

properties.name: animation
properties.description: Either this and the below positions are loaded, or the animation properties for each direction are loaded.

properties.name: equipment
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Equipment.

properties.name: flare
properties.description: Name of Prototype/ArtilleryFlare.

properties.name: damage_type
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/DamageType.

properties.name: art_style
properties.description: The visualization is chosen based on the Prototype/Module#art_style, meaning if module art style == beacon module visualization art style then this visualization is chosen. Vanilla uses "vanilla" here.

properties.name: slots
properties.description: The outer array contains the different slots, the inner array contains the different layers for those slots (with different tints etc).

properties.name: effect
properties.description: Required, read by the game and then immediately discarded. In short: Does nothing.

properties.name: cluster_count
properties.description: Must be at least 2.

properties.name: decorative
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Decorative.

properties.name: spawn_max_radius
properties.description: Must be less than 24.

properties.name: entity_name
properties.description: Name of the entity that should be created.

properties.name: trigger_created_entity
properties.description: If this is true, on_trigger_created_entity is raised when the entity is created.

properties.name: particle_name
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Particle.

properties.name: tail_length
properties.description: Silently capped to a maximum of 100.

properties.name: tail_length_deviation
properties.description: Silently capped to a maximum of 100.

properties.name: sticker
properties.description: Name of the Prototype/Sticker that should be created.

properties.name: trigger_created_entity
properties.description: If this is true, on_trigger_created_entity is raised when the entity is created.

properties.name: uses_stack
properties.description: Whether using the capsule consumes an item from the stack.

properties.name: explosion
properties.description: Name of an entity.

properties.name: include_soft_decoratives
properties.description: Soft decoratives are decoratives with Prototype/Decorative#grows_through_rail_path = true.

properties.name: decoratives_with_trigger_only
properties.description: If true, destroys only decoratives that have a Prototype/Decorative#trigger_effect set.

Types/ElectricUsagePriority.description: Used to specify priority of energy usage in the Electric network.

value.primary-input: As input used for the most important machines, currently used for laser turrets.
value.secondary-input: As input used for all other machines.
value.secondary-output: As output used in steam generators.
value.tertiary: As input/output used for accumulators, to collect the overproduction or provide energy when neither primary/secondary output can't.
value.solar: Can only be used by Prototype/SolarPanel, will be ignored otherwise.
value.lamp: Can only be used by Prototype/Lamp, will be ignored otherwise.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of a Prototype/Fluid.

properties.name: probability
properties.description: Value between 0 and 1, 0 for 0% chance and 1 for 100% chance.

properties.name: probability
properties.description: Value between 0 and 1, 0 for 0% chance and 1 for 100% chance.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: Cannot be < 0.

properties.name: amount_min
properties.description:
Mandatory if amount is not specified.

May not be < 0.

properties.name: amount_max
properties.description:
Mandatory if amount is not specified.

If set to a number that is less than amount_min, the game will use amount_min internally.

properties.name: temperature
properties.description: Sets the temperature of the fluid product.

properties.name: catalyst_amount
properties.description: Amount that should not be affected by productivity modules (not yielded from bonus production) and should not be included in the fluid production statistics.

properties.name: fluidbox_index
properties.description: Used to specify which fluidbox this product should use on the machine. It will only use this one fluidbox.

Types/HeatConnection.description: Defines the connections for a heat energy source in Types/EnergySource.

properties.name: item
properties.description: Name of the Prototype/Item that should be created.

Types/ItemIngredientPrototype.description: An item ingredient definition for a Prototype/Recipe. Its loading is triggered by the type of a Types/IngredientPrototype being "item". It can be specified as a table with named or numbered keys, but not a mix of both.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of a Prototype/Item.

properties.name: catalyst_amount
properties.description: Only loaded if the table is using named keys. Amount of this ingredient that should not be included in the item consumption statistics. Usually used together with an equal catalyst amount on the "product" of the catalyst in the recipe.

Types/LightFlickeringDefinition.description: Specifies the light flicker. Note that this defaults to "showing a white light" instead of the usually expected "showing nothing".

properties.name: minimum_intensity
properties.description: Brightness of the light in the range [0, 1] where 0 is no light and 1 is the maximum light.

properties.name: maximum_intensity
properties.description: Brightness of the light in the range [0, 1] where 0 is no light and 1 is the maximum light.

properties.name: minimum_light_size
properties.description: The radius of the light in tiles. Note, that the light gets darker near the edges, so the effective size of the light seems to be smaller.

properties.name: color
properties.description: Color of the light.

Types/PipeConnectionDefinition.description:
Definition of a pipe connection. Used in fluidboxes.

Either position or positions must be specified. (position takes priority)

properties.name: position
properties.description: Position of the pipe connection.

properties.name: positions
properties.description: Table must have 4 members, which are 4 explicit positions for the pipe connection (corresponding to 4 directions). Positions must correspond to directions going one after another.

properties.name: max_underground_distance
properties.description: 0 means not underground.

properties.name: min_distance
properties.description: Negative values are silently clamped to 0.

properties.name: max_distance
properties.description: Negative values are silently clamped to 0.

properties.name: volume_modifier
properties.description: Negative values are silently clamped to 0.

properties.name: audible_distance_modifier
properties.description: Negative values are silently clamped to 0.

Types/Position.description:
Coordinates of a tile in a map. Positions may be specified either as a dictionary with x, y as keys, or simply as an array with two elements.

The coordinates are fixed size int: 32 bit with 8 bits reserved for sub 1 precision, this means that it's smallest value step is 1/2^8 = 0.00390625.

Types/RealOrientation.description: Specified by a Types/float between 0 and 1, including 0 and excluding 1.

properties.name: effect_id
properties.description: The effect_id that will be provided in on_script_trigger_effect.

properties.name: tile_name
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Tile.

Types/SpawnPoint.description: The definition of a evolution and probability weights for a spawnable unit (Types/UnitSpawnDefinition) for a Prototype/EnemySpawner. It can be specified as a table with named or numbered keys, but not a mix of both.

properties.name: spawn_weight
properties.description: Must be >= 0.

properties.name: filename
properties.description: Technically optional, but path to sprite cannot be empty.

properties.name: frames
properties.description: Specifies how many of the directions of the SpriteNWay are filled up with this sheet.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description: If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, its contents are used to load the SpriteNWaySheet.

properties.name: size
properties.description:
The width and height of the sprite. If this is an array, the first member of the array is the width and the second is the height. Otherwise the size is both width and height.

Width and height may only be in the range of 0-8192.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Mandatory if size is not given. Width of the picture in pixels, from 0-8192.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Mandatory if size is not given. Height of the picture in pixels, from 0-8192.

properties.name: x
properties.description: Horizontal position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: y
properties.description: Vertical position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: position
properties.description: Loaded only when x and y are both 0. The first member of the array is x and the second is y.

properties.name: shift
properties.description: In tiles. util.by_pixel() can be used to divide the shift by 32 which is the usual pixel height/width of 1 tile in normal resolution. Note that 32 pixel tile height/width is not enforced anywhere - any other tile height or width is also possible.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: Values different than 1 specify the scale of the sprite on default zoom. Scale 2 means that the picture will be 2 times bigger on screen (and more pixelated).

properties.name: mipmap_count
properties.description: Only loaded if this is an icon (has flag "group=icon" or "group=gui").

properties.name: load_in_minimal_mode
properties.description: Minimal mode is entered when mod loading fails. You are in it when you see the gray box after (part of) the loading screen that tells you a mod error (Example). If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property.

properties.name: premul_alpha
properties.description: Whether alpha should be premultiplied.

properties.name: fluids
properties.description: Controls which fluids can fuel this stream attack and their potential damage bonuses.

properties.name: count
properties.description: Frame count.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description: If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, its contents are used to load the tile sprite.

properties.name: x
properties.description: Horizontal position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: y
properties.description: Vertical position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

Types/TileTransitionSprite.description: Used by Types/TileTransitions which is used by Prototype/Tile.

properties.name: count
properties.description: Frame count.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description: If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, its contents are used to load the tile transition sprite.

properties.name: tall
properties.description: If this is true, the shift of the tile transition sprite is set to {0, 0.5}.

properties.name: x
properties.description: Horizontal position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: y
properties.description: Vertical position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: uses_stack
properties.description: Whether using the capsule consumes an item from the stack.

properties.name: probability
properties.description: Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.

properties.name: damage_type_filters
properties.description: Guaranteed to work with Prototype/EntityWithHealth#damaged_trigger_effect and Prototype/EntityWithHealth#dying_trigger_effect, unknown if it works with other properties that use Types/TriggerEffect.

properties.name: uses_stack
properties.description: Whether using the capsule consumes an item from the stack.

properties.name: entity_flags
properties.description: Only prototypes with these flags are affected by the trigger item.

properties.name: probability
properties.description: Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Only prototypes with these collision masks are affected by the trigger item.

properties.name: force
properties.description: Only entities meeting the force condition are affected by the trigger item.

Types/BaseAttackParameters.description: The abstract base of all attack parameters.

properties.name: cooldown
properties.description: Number of ticks in which it will be possible to shoot again. If < 1, multiple shots can be performed in one tick.

properties.name: turn_range
properties.description: If this is <= 0, it is set to 1. Arc from 0 to 1, so for example 0.25 is 90. Used by the flamethrower turret in the base game.

properties.name: fire_penalty
properties.description: Used when searching for the nearest enemy, when this is > 0, enemies that aren't burning are preferred over burning enemies. Definition of "burning" for this: Entity has sticker attached to it, and the sticker has a spread_fire_entity set.

properties.name: rotate_penalty
properties.description: A higher penalty will discourage turrets from targeting units that would take longer to turn to face.

properties.name: health_penalty
properties.description: A higher penalty will discourage turrets from targeting units with higher health. A negative penalty will encourage turrets to target units with higher health.

properties.name: min_attack_distance
properties.description: If less than range, the entity will choose a random distance between range and min_attack_distance and attack from that distance.

properties.name: ammo_consumption_modifier
properties.description: Must be greater than or equal to 0.

properties.name: cooldown_deviation
properties.description: Must be between 0 and 1.

properties.name: warmup
properties.description: Number of ticks it takes for the weapon to actually shoot after the order for shooting has been made. This also allows to "adjust" the shooting animation to the effect of shooting.

properties.name: lead_target_for_projectile_speed
properties.description: Presumably this should be set to the projectile speed to make the unit/turret lead their projectiles.

properties.name: ammo_type
properties.description: Can be mandatory.

properties.name: ammo_categories
properties.description: Names of Prototype/AmmoCategories.

properties.name: ammo_category
properties.description: The name of a Prototype/AmmoCategory. Mandatory if ammo_type and ammo_category is not given, otherwise ignored.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Entity.

Types/CircularProjectileCreationSpecific.description: An array of arrays. The first member of the inner arrays is a Types/RealOrientation, the second member is a Types/vector.

Types/DamageTypeFilters.description: Either a dictionary (Types/table) with the below properties, an array (Types/table) of names of Prototype/DamageTypes (Types/strings), or one name of a Prototype/DamageType (Types/string).

properties.name: types
properties.description: Name or names of Prototype/DamageTypes.

properties.name: projectile
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Projectile.

properties.name: starting_speed
properties.description: Starting speed in tiles per tick.

properties.name: explosion
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Explosion.

properties.name: beam
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Beam.

properties.name: stream
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/FluidStream.

properties.name: projectile
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/ArtilleryProjectile.

Types/IconSpecification.description:
Specifies the icon of an entity/item/technology/recipe etc. The properties are specified directly in the prototype, not in another sub-property.

Either icons and optionally icon_size, or both icon and icon_size have to be specified. If both icons and icon are defined, icon is ignored.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Path to the icon file.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: The rendering order of the individual icons follows the table (array) order: Later added icons (higher index) get drawn on top of previously added icons (lower index).

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description: Mandatory if icon_size is not specified inside all instances of Types/IconData inside icons. The size of the square icon, in pixels, e.g. 32 for a 32px by 32px icon.

Types/IconData.description: Data of one icon "layer" for the icons property of the Types/IconSpecification.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Path to the icon file.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description: Mandatory if icon_size is not specified outside of icons. The size of the square icon, in pixels, e.g. 32 for a 32px by 32px icon.

properties.name: tint
properties.description: Tint of the icon.

properties.name: shift
properties.description: Used to offset the icon "layer" from the overall icon.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: Values different than 1 specify the scale of the icon on default gui scale. Scale 2 means that the icon will be 2 times bigger on screen (and more pixelated).

properties.name: progress_threshold
properties.description: If count already playing is true, this will determine maximum progress when instance is counted toward playing sounds.

properties.name: count_already_playing
properties.description: If true already playing sounds are taken into account when checking maxCount.

properties.name: recipe_difficulty
properties.description: A defines.difficulty_settings.recipe_difficulty.

properties.name: technology_difficulty
properties.description: A defines.difficulty_settings.technology_difficulty.

properties.name: time_factor
properties.description: Percentual increase in the evolution factor for every second (60 ticks)

properties.name: destroy_factor
properties.description: Percentual increase in the evolution factor for every destroyed spawner

properties.name: pollution_factor
properties.description: Percentual increase in the evolution factor for 1 pollution unit

properties.name: max_expansion_distance
properties.description: Distance in chunks from the furthest base around. This prevents expansions from reaching too far into the player's territory.

properties.name: max_colliding_tiles_coefficient
properties.description: A chunk has to have at most this much percent unbuildable tiles for it to be considered a candidate. This is to avoid chunks full of water to be marked as candidates.

properties.name: settler_group_min_size
properties.description: Size of the group that goes to build new base (the game interpolates between min size and max size based on evolution factor).

properties.name: min_expansion_cooldown
properties.description: Ticks to expand to a single position for a base is used. Cooldown is calculated as follows: cooldown = lerp(max_expansion_cooldown, min_expansion_cooldown, -e^2 + 2 * e) where lerp is the linear interpolation function, and e is the current evolution factor.

properties.name: fwd2bwd_ratio
properties.description: Defines whether we prefer forward (>1) or backward (<-1) or symmetrical (1) search.

properties.name: goal_pressure_ratio
properties.description: When comparing nodes in open which one to check next, heuristic value is multiplied by this ratio. The higher the number the more is the search directed directly towards the goal.

properties.name: max_steps_worked_per_tick
properties.description: When this is exhausted no more requests are allowed, at the moment the first path to exhaust this will be finished (even if it is hundreds of steps).

properties.name: short_cache_size
properties.description: Number of elements in the cache.

properties.name: short_cache_min_cacheable_distance
properties.description: Minimal distance to goal for path to be searched in short path cache.

properties.name: short_cache_min_algo_steps_to_cache
properties.description: Minimal number of algorithm steps for path to be inserted into the short path cache.

properties.name: long_cache_min_cacheable_distance
properties.description: Minimal distance to goal for path to be searched in long path cache.

properties.name: cache_max_connect_to_cache_steps_multiplier
properties.description: When searching for connection to path cache path, search at most for this number of steps times the initial estimate.

properties.name: cache_accept_path_start_distance_ratio
properties.description: When looking for path from cache make sure it doesn't start too far from requested start in relative distance terms.

properties.name: cache_accept_path_end_distance_ratio
properties.description: When looking for path from cache make sure it doesn't end too far from requested end. This is typically higher than accept value for the start because the end target can be moving.

properties.name: negative_cache_accept_path_start_distance_ratio
properties.description: Same as cache_accept_path_start_distance_ratio, but used for negative cache queries.

properties.name: negative_cache_accept_path_end_distance_ratio
properties.description: Same as cache_accept_path_end_distance_ratio, but used for negative cache queries.

properties.name: cache_path_start_distance_rating_multiplier
properties.description: When assigning rating to the best path this * start distances is considered.

properties.name: cache_path_end_distance_rating_multiplier
properties.description: When assigning rating to the best path this * end distances is considered. This is typically higher than value for the start to achieve better path end quality.

properties.name: stale_enemy_with_same_destination_collision_penalty
