properties.description: Somewhere along the path is stuck enemy we need to avoid. This is mainly to handle situations when units have arrived and are attacking the target then units further in the back will use this and run around the target.

properties.name: ignore_moving_enemy_collision_distance
properties.description: If there is a moving unit further than this we don't really care.

properties.name: enemy_with_different_destination_collision_penalty
properties.description: Enemy is not moving/or is too close and has different destination.

properties.name: general_entity_collision_penalty
properties.description: Simplification for now; collision with everything else is this.

properties.name: general_entity_subsequent_collision_penalty
properties.description: Collision penalty for successors of positions that require destroy to reach.

properties.name: extended_collision_penalty
properties.description: Collision penalty for collisions in the extended bounding box but outside the entity's actual bounding box.

properties.name: max_clients_to_accept_any_new_request
properties.description: Up until this amount any client will be served by the path finder (no estimate on the path length).

properties.name: max_clients_to_accept_short_new_request
properties.description: From max_clients_to_accept_any_new_request till this one only those that have a short estimate will be served.

properties.name: direct_distance_to_consider_short_request
properties.description: This is the "threshold" to decide what is short and what is not.

properties.name: short_request_max_steps
properties.description: If a short request takes more than this many steps, it will be rescheduled as a long request.

properties.name: short_request_ratio
properties.description: How many steps will be allocated to short requests each tick, as a ratio of all available steps per tick.

properties.name: min_steps_to_check_path_find_termination
properties.description: Absolute minimum of steps that will be performed for every path find request no matter what.

properties.name: start_to_goal_cost_multiplier_to_terminate_path_find
properties.description: If the current actual cost from start is higher than this times estimate of start to goal then path finding is terminated.

properties.name: diffusion_ratio
properties.description: Amount that is diffused to neighboring chunks

properties.name: min_to_diffuse
properties.description: This much pollution units must be on the chunk to start diffusing

properties.name: ageing
properties.description: Constant modifier a percentage of 1; the pollution eaten by a chunks tiles

properties.name: expected_max_per_chunk
properties.description: Anything bigger than this is visualised as this value

properties.name: min_to_show_per_chunk
properties.description: Anything lower than this (but > 0) is visualised as this value

properties.name: radius
properties.description: Not including the radius of the unit

properties.name: force_unit_fuzzy_goto_behavior
properties.description: Used only for special "to look good" purposes (like in trailer)

properties.name: min_group_gathering_time
properties.description: Pollution triggered group waiting time is a random time between min and max gathering time

properties.name: max_wait_time_for_late_members
properties.description: After the gathering is finished the group can still wait for late members, but it doesn't accept new ones anymore.

properties.name: max_group_radius
properties.description: Limits for group radius (calculated by number of numbers).

properties.name: max_member_speedup_when_behind
properties.description: When a member falls behind the group he can speedup up till this much of his regular speed.

properties.name: max_member_slowdown_when_ahead
properties.description: When a member gets ahead of its group, it will slow down to at most this factor of its speed.

properties.name: max_group_slowdown_factor
properties.description: When members of a group are behind, the entire group will slow down to at most this factor of its max speed.

properties.name: max_group_member_fallback_factor
properties.description: If a member falls behind more than this times the group radius, the group will slow down to max_group_slowdown_factor.

properties.name: member_disown_distance
properties.description: If a member falls behind more than this time the group radius, it will be removed from the group.

properties.name: max_gathering_unit_groups
properties.description: Maximum number of automatically created unit groups gathering for attack at any time.

properties.name: max_unit_group_size
properties.description: Maximum size of an attack unit group. This only affects automatically-created unit groups; manual groups created through the API are unaffected.

value.blueprint: The normal rules for acceptable entities in blueprints
value.deconstruct: The normal rules for acceptable entities for deconstruction
value.cancel-deconstruct: The normal rules for acceptable entities for cancel deconstruction
value.buildable-type: Buildable entities as defined by the game
value.items-to-place: The entity has an item that builds the entity
value.same-force: The entity force matches that of the player doing the selection
value.not-same-force: The entity force does not match that of the player doing the selection
value.friend: The entity force is friend to that of the player doing the selection
value.enemy: The entity force is enemy to that of the player doing the selection
value.upgrade: The normal rules for acceptable entities in upgrade planners
value.cancel-upgrade: The normal rules for acceptable entities for cancel upgrade

properties.name: is_whole_box
properties.description: Whether this is a complete box or just the top left corner. If this is true, side_length and side_height must be present. Otherwise max_side_length must be present.

properties.name: side_length
properties.description: Only read if is_whole_box is true.

properties.name: side_height
properties.description: Only read if is_whole_box is true.

properties.name: max_side_length
properties.description: Only read if is_whole_box is false.

properties.name: sheets
properties.description: If given, this is used instead of any other properties that may be present.

properties.name: sheet
properties.description: If given, and #sheets isnt present, this is used instead of any other properties that may be present.

Types/RailPieceLayers.description: Used for graphics by Prototype/Rails and Prototype/RailRemnants.

properties.name: metals
properties.description: Must have between 1 and 4 variations.

properties.name: backplates
properties.description: Must have same number of variations as metals.

properties.name: ties
properties.description: Must have between 1 and 4 variations.

properties.name: stone_path
properties.description: Must have between 1 and 4 variations.

properties.name: stone_path_background
properties.description: Must have less or equal than 4 variations.

properties.name: animation
properties.description: Rendered in "object" layer, with secondary draw order 0.

properties.name: fluid_animation
properties.description: Rendered in "object" layer, with secondary draw order 20.

properties.name: glass_pictures
properties.description: Rendered in "object" layer, with secondary draw order 40.

properties.name: base_pictures
properties.description: Rendered in layer specified by base_render_layer, with secondary draw order 0.

properties.name: underwater_pictures
properties.description: Drawn by tile renderer when water animation is enabled.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of an item.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: Must be positive.

properties.name: required_item
properties.description: Name of an item.

value.default: Items are inserted into this item-with-inventory only if they match the whitelist defined in the prototype for the item and whitelist is used.
value.never: Items are never inserted into this item-with-inventory except explicitly by the player or script.
value.always: All items first try to be inserted into this item-with-inventory.
value.when_manually_filtered: When the inventory contains filters that match the item-to-be-inserted then try to put it into this item before the inventory this item resides in.

properties.name: technology
properties.description:
Read if type is "research-technology".

Name of the technology that triggers this tutorial when it is researched.

properties.name: entity
properties.description:
Read if type is "build-entity".

Name of the entity that triggers this tutorial when it is built.

properties.name: item
properties.description:
Read if type is "craft-item".

Name of the item that triggers this tutorial when it is crafted.

properties.name: count
properties.description:
Read if type is "manual-transfer".

Amount of times manual item transfer has to be done to trigger this tutorial.

properties.name: material_background
properties.description: Width and height are given by the game, setting them will not have an effect. Width and height are calculated from the expected size (32) and the scale. So, for HR tiles at a size of 64x64, the scale needs to be 0.5.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Only powers of 2 from 1 to 128 can be used. Square size of the tile arrangement this animation is used for. Used to calculate the width and height of the animation which cannot be set directly. (width or height) = size * 32 / scale.

properties.name: probability
properties.description: Probability of 1x1 (size = 1) version of tile must be 1.

properties.name: count
properties.description: How many units are needed. Must be positive. May not be specified if count_formula is specified.

properties.name: count_formula
properties.description: Formula that specifies how many units are needed per level of the infinite technology. May not be specified if count is specified. The formula is executed following the BODMAS order.

properties.name: time
properties.description: How much time is needed per one unit, in lab with crafting speed 1 it is the number of seconds.

properties.name: ingredients
properties.description: list of ingredients needed for one unit of research. The item types must all be tools.

properties.name: tile
properties.description: Name of a tile.

properties.name: default_friendly_color_by_type
properties.description: The strings are entity types.

properties.name: default_color_by_type
properties.description: The strings are entity types.

properties.name: train_waiting_at_signal_tick_multiplier_penalty
properties.description: Must be >= 0.

properties.name: matrix
properties.description: 4 arrays of 4-length float arrays, essentially a 4x4 matrix

properties.name: left
properties.description: Min value 6, max value 15 - Min value 6 to compensate for shadows

properties.name: top
properties.description: Min value 3, max value 15

properties.name: right
properties.description: Min value 3, max value 15

properties.name: bottom
properties.description: Min value 4, max value 15 - Min value 4 to compensate for tall entities like electric poles

properties.name: warmup_frame_sequence
properties.description: Indices of frames from the attack parameter animation.

properties.name: warmup2_frame_sequence
properties.description: Indices of frames from the attack parameter animation.

properties.name: attacking_frame_sequence
properties.description: Indices of frames from the attack parameter animation.

properties.name: cooldown_frame_sequence
properties.description: Indices of frames from the attack parameter animation.

properties.name: prepared_frame_sequence
properties.description: Indices of frames from the attack parameter animation.

properties.name: back_to_walk_frame_sequence
properties.description: Indices of frames from the attack parameter animation.

properties.name: frames
properties.description: Sizes of all frames arrays must be the same.

properties.name: bonus
properties.description: Precision is ignored beyond two decimals - 17.567 results in 17.56 etc.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Fluid.

properties.name: ingredients
properties.description:
A table containing ingredient names and counts. Can also contain information about fluid temperature and catalyst amounts.

Maximal ingredient amount is 65535. The catalyst amounts are automatically calculated from the recipe, or can be set manually.[1]

properties.name: allow_as_intermediate
properties.description: Optional. Whether the recipe can be used as an intermediate recipe in hand-crafting.

properties.name: allow_decomposition
properties.description: Optional. Whether this recipe is allowed to be broken down for the recipe tooltip "Total raw" calculations.

properties.name: allow_intermediates
properties.description: Optional. Whether the recipe is allowed to use intermediate recipes when hand-crafting.

properties.name: always_show_made_in
properties.description: Optional. Whether the "Made in: {Machine}" part of the tool-tip should always be present, not only when the recipe can not be hand-crafted.

properties.name: always_show_products
properties.description: Optional. Whether the products are always shown in the recipe tool-tip.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description:
Optional. This can be false to disable the recipe at the start of the game, or "true" to leave it enabled.

If your recipe is unlocked by a technology, you should set this to "false".

properties.name: energy_required
properties.description:
Optional. The amount of time it takes to make this recipe.

This is the number of seconds it takes to craft at crafting speed 1.

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: Optional. Hides the recipe from crafting menus.

properties.name: hide_from_player_crafting
properties.description: Optional. Hides the recipe from the player's crafting screen. The recipe will still show up for selection in machines.

properties.name: hide_from_stats
properties.description: Optional. Hides the recipe from flow stats (item/fluid production statistics).

properties.name: main_product
properties.description:
For recipes with more than one product: This defines of which result the icon, subgroup and name is used. If it is not set and the recipe has more than 1 result the recipe will use the recipe-name and recipe-description locale and its own subgroup and icon.

For recipes with 1 result: The recipe uses the icon, subgroup and name of the result by default. If set this property is set to an empty string, the recipe will use the properties of the recipe instead of the result.

properties.name: overload_multiplier
properties.description:
Used to determine how many extra items are put into an assembling machine before it's considered "full enough". See Inserters#Insertion_limits.

If set to 0, it instead uses the following formula: 1.166 / (energy_required / the assembler's crafting_speed), rounded up, and clamped between 2 and 100.

properties.name: result
properties.description: Can be replaced with the results parameter. The item created by this recipe. Must be the name of an item, such as "iron-gear-wheel".

properties.name: result_count
properties.description: Optional. The number of items created by this recipe.

properties.name: results
properties.description: A table containing result names and counts. Can also contain information about fluid temperature and catalyst amounts. The catalyst amounts are automatically calculated from the recipe, or can be set manually.[2]

properties.name: show_amount_in_title
properties.description: Optional. Whether the recipe name should have the product amount in front of it, e.g. "2 transport belt"

properties.name: unlock_results
properties.description: Optional. Whether enabling this recipe unlocks its item products to show in selection lists (item filter, logistic request etc.).

properties.name: effects
properties.description: List of effects of the technology (applied when the technology is researched).

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: Hides the technology from the tech screen.

properties.name: max_level
properties.description: "infinite" for infinite technologies, otherwise uint.

properties.name: prerequisites
properties.description: List of technologies needed to be researched before this one can be researched.

properties.name: upgrade
properties.description: When set to true, and the technology contains several levels, only the relevant one is displayed in the technology screen.

properties.name: visible_when_disabled
properties.description: Controls whether the technology is shown in the tech GUI when it is disabled (enabled = false).
